reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

description.narrative: 1. Project: 11782 KECO MFA frame Funded Projects PMER Support 2. Project area and Country: Kenya 3. Project justification: Field office presence is essential for increased programme impact and quality. It is in line with FCA?s strategy, and supports the s trategic goals related to programme development and quality, capacity building, advocacy, thematic/technical support, monitoring and diversification of the funding base. 4. The main objective and expected results: The main objective is to improve the effec tiveness, quality, and impact of the FCA Country Programme in the thematic focus areas through established field presence. This will be achieved through establishing a functional working relationship and collaboration with UN agencies, I/NGOs, CBOs and gov ernment authorities at district and national level. Where necessary, new partnerships will be established for enhanced added value of operations and to broaden funding opportunities, as well as to promote effective coordination of work and cooperation. Str ategic and operational planning for the country programme, including programme and project PME and administrative support, will also contribute to achieving the main objective of the country programme. 5. Right-holders/ beneficiaries: Kenya Country Office staff, including programme staff, administration and finance. 6. Partners: Local and regional civil society actors, international organizations, donors 7. Budget 2018: Total budget EUR 319, 200
